content: In the game of Go, the rule of Ko (a term meaning eternity in Japanese) prevents repeating indefinitely between adjacent intersections, now the capture of a stone by a player, and then the capture of the capturing stone by the opponent.
translations: ita:Nel gioco del Go, la regola del ko (termine che in giapponese significa eternit√†) impedisce di ripetere all'infinito tra
credits: Sentence from Tatoeba by carlosalberto (CC-BY 2.0 FR)
